content:
Diagnosis:
Left breast cancer - mixed mucinous and neuroendocrine carcinoma
T2N1Mx, Grade 2
ER positive (8/8), PR low positive (2/8), HER2 2+ (FISH pending)

Previous Treatment:
Wide local excision and axillary clearance 15 Jan 2024
3/12 nodes positive, largest deposit 12mm
Commenced adjuvant FEC-T chemotherapy March 2024

Current medications:
Ondansetron 8mg bd
Dexamethasone 8mg bd (days 1-3 of each cycle)
Pegfilgrastim 6mg SC day 2

Allergies:
None reported

Current situation:
Pre cycle 4 FEC

I reviewed [redacted name] today prior to cycle 4 FEC chemotherapy. The previous cycle was complicated by grade 2 neutropenia requiring a 1-week delay, though she has now recovered with neutrophils 1.8. She reports ongoing grade 1 peripheral neuropathy affecting fingertips only, and grade 1 fatigue that improves by day 10 of each cycle. No significant nausea with current antiemetic regime. Performance status remains 0.

HER2 FISH testing results are pending and will guide addition of targeted therapy. Bloods today show adequate parameters for treatment. The plan is to proceed with cycle 4 FEC at full dose with enhanced GCSF support. We will review again in 3 weeks for final FEC cycle, then transition to docetaxel pending satisfactory recovery.

primary_cancer.biomarker_status: ER positive (8/8), PR low positive (2/8), HER2 2+ (FISH pending)

cancer_timeline.value: Wide local excision and axillary clearance, 3/12 nodes positive
Cycle 3 delayed by 1 week due to grade 2 neutropenia

patient_facts.value: Grade 1 fatigue improving by day 10 of each cycle

status_updates.value: Early breast cancer on adjuvant FEC chemotherapy. Previous cycle delayed due to neutropenia but now recovered and tolerating treatment well
Grade 2 neutropenia with previous cycle, grade 1 peripheral neuropathy and fatigue
Proceeding with cycle 4 FEC at full dose with enhanced GCSF support
Review in 3 weeks for final FEC cycle before transitioning to docetaxel
